website_summaries.verdict: Versatile ping-pong paddle designed for novice and intermediate players alike.
pros: Body includes five layers of wood, guaranteeing the paddle will serve you well for years to come
Rubber handle makes it simple to control the paddle
Equipped with PVC tape to protect sides of paddle
cons: Paddle head is sometimes unstable and wobbly
Less durable than many comparable paddles

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: First time using this new paddle I was amazed at the spin and control. Having only used the paddles that came with the table these are a huge upgrade. I entered a tournament that our city puts on every year and took second place. Decided table tennis might be my future so I asked my job to only work me part time and have been training daily hoping to make the Olympic team. Some say I am crazy but when you enter a tournament of 9 people which only 4 of them were children and you get second place it is an obvious sign that you are a table tennis master. Look for me in Tokyo 2020
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Plays nice for the price. Poorly constructed handle.
customer_reviews.text: Got the green color. Looks nice and plays nice compared to super cheap paddles. Easy control and decent spin. Suited my beginner skills well. Major issue: grip fell off one side after a few weeks of semi-regular use. Glued back on, still works fine. Shouldn't have to deal with that type of issue with a $30ish paddle. Would've given 5 stars but too expensive for something so cheaply constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Elevate your game. The green will make your back spin deadly
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for skilled players that play for fun. At this price this paddle has exceeded all expectations . Crazy control allowed me to improve my game and my back spin. my defense too has gotten much much better. One side of the paddle has more cushion for defense (green) and backspin and the black side is harder which allows me to go on the attack with greater speed. Ill take my paddle over any of the top 10 paddles on the internet. Lastly the white case it comes in is great to protect the paddle, its not bulky but its strong
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Otamendi

customer_reviews.title: HUGE upgrade from the cheap entry level paddles.
customer_reviews.text: Would never have thought a paddle would make such a difference! Control, spin, accuracy, things I never thought possible after always using the basic paddles that come with sets. Whether it be for a friends house, on vacation, or an office game this thing is a great toy to have. Good rubber, nice balance, and almost double the thickness of the cheap ones. For a few bucks as a recreational player, you can't go wrong. Priced very competitively against many other options in this grade of paddle. Amazon comes through yet again!
customer_reviews.author: Your Name Here

customer_reviews.title: Decent paddle, and gets you in free at Killerspin ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent paddle, and gets you in free at Killerspin if you are nearby one. I only got this because ping pong at the office started to get competitive and the community paddles deteriorated. You'll definitely notice the difference if you are switching from one of the cheap ones to that come in a bundle to this one. I will note that it has since cracked, scratched, and started to leech it's blue color on my hand but thats to be expected when playing competitively over a period of time and your hands get moist.
customer_reviews.author: Cool IT Guy '86

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to play with
customer_reviews.text: Lovely presentation box, nice spin control, but man...I have sore fingers. The light wood where it meets the handle is a reasonably sharp, untreated edge. It's super uncomfortable to play with :(
customer_reviews.author: Jacklantic

customer_reviews.title: Added a new dimension to my ping pong game
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the cheapest paddles for years, typical recreation, cheap thin plywood with pips. These took a few days to get used to, being a real paddle. They seemed heavy at first, but I don't notice the weight now. The pads are great! Good stickiness to add 1000% more spin relative to my previous "paddles". Good control as well. Perhaps I can't hit as fast as before, but I'd much rather have the control and spin than speed at this point. I've been playing 3-4 times a week with my son now. Before we played once a month. Makes the games much more fun and interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first upgrade from the generic paddles. You will have much greater control, awesome spin, and decent speed. However, the handle feels rough in your hand and this paddle is quite heavy. For 15$ I’m pretty impressed. I used to split games with my daughter (I played with generic Eastpoint paddle, she has a Stiga Pro). Now I am stomping her guts out in glorious fashion.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I'm a beginner playing ping pong and probably average 30 mins every other day playing at work during lunch. My first purchased paddle was the Killerspin Jet 200 and enjoyed it for the past few months. However, just last week, after hitting the paddle on myself after a bad shot, the area where the handle meets the rubbers broke and is now requiring that I reach out to see if this is common or not? I'm hoping that this is a bad batch vs. the quality of the wood on these paddles. Your mileage may vary, but I figure it's worth putting out there to see if this is common?
customer_reviews.author: dung tri lam

customer_reviews.title: Good Paddle for beginner to intermediate players.
customer_reviews.text: We got a table tennis table installed in our employee recreation area. All of the sudden everyone was playing. But they provided just basic recreational paddles. As a former collegiate tennis player I quickly improved but found myself playing others who had some rather advanced paddles. I bought this one just to have around my desk for daily use. It's a good value. The rubber is tacky enough to put pretty good spin on the ball and the power is decent. But if you are a tournament player, obviously you would want something much more advanced. And obviously the rubber colors are not sanctioned for tournament play.
customer_reviews.author: E Trane

customer_reviews.title: Quality in most areas.  Most
customer_reviews.text: Playability is good. Faces are decent for price. Ball off paddle bounce is nice. Grip is good for spins for top spin or slices. The handle is the only part not of super quality. I guess you are getting what you pay for. The handle parts where you see the wood on the bottom of the face seems cheapish and the brand insignia is in a hole that you can feel on your palm as you play giving more to that cheap feel.
customer_reviews.author: The Saeko

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Paddle Especially at Price - Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grip, lightweight, cool detailed design and color, high quality padding and packaged in a very high end box that gives it a ultra premium feel even if it is at mid price point. Have had two weeks so can’t comment on longevity. But it was a huge hit for nephew who has gotten into table tennis. For price point sub-$35, can’t beat it based on look and feel of play out of box. Way over delivers right from start. Hope it stays in good shape. Seems like it will.
customer_reviews.author: RCSNYC2020

customer_reviews.title: About 2 hours of use, the rubber and glue is already coming off.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was supposed to be a quality racket +$30 but the rubber is already shredding and stripping off, from normal light ping pong use of 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Levine

customer_reviews.title: nice paddle, but not the model listed.
customer_reviews.text: Nice paddle, but I received the jet100 paddle not the jet200. It's not the end of the world I just feel mislead and slightly disappointed i didn't receive the right one. I needed them tonight, I don't have time to return them before they're going to be used so an exchange isn't really an option. I'm not completely dissatisfied but I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddles
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these ping pong paddles for my bedroom-ping pong table. It’s full sized, and I’m quite an avid table tennis player myself. I really enjoy these paddles a lot. They are lightweight, have the perfect amount of cushion, and let you send the ball flying with pinpoint accuracy. They really assist me with putting spin on the ball. One problem, however, is the tape around the edges of the cushion of the paddle does like to come a little loose, especially if you use the paddle as much as I do. If you’re serious about the gamer of table tennis, this paddle is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Georges

customer_reviews.title: Nice little paddle...
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely a difference in the way the ball hits off this softer surface compared to the diimpled surface I've always played with. It allows one to make a softer hit if required to fake out opponents. The ideal paddle for me, though, would be the soft surface on one side and the hard dimpled surfact on the other. I could change the pace of the game depending on how I want to hit the ball. Anyway, it seems to be a sturdy racket and the surface is attached well. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Feels heavy to me but performs very well if you can get used to it
customer_reviews.text: This paddle feels really heavy compared to others. Makes me slower to respond and is a challenge to adapt to. On the upside it seems well constructed and has performed well. I just wish I had known how heavy it feels in hand.
customer_reviews.author: expert_101

customer_reviews.title: Nice Paddle!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This paddles feels great. Much better than the ones at the shop! I thought a paddle was a paddle but after using this one a while now I notice he difference for the old paddle I was using. I tried my only paddle and that paddle has no bounce at all! Now a few guys in the shop is getting their own paddle because they use to beat me with ease but not any more! They have seen such an improvement in my game!
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: The Weapon of a Jedi
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle. I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to improve their game and start giving the ball some nasty spin. Takes getting used to if you're new or accustomed to cheap paddles, but it's certainly durable, since it's remained fully intact despite my hand sweating all over the handle and me chucking it onto the ground a bunch of times when my game was off (wasn't the paddle's fault). The colored handle is also a really nice touch. I use the shakehand style grip, and I would definitely shake hands with anyone else who uses this paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Obdimus

customer_reviews.title: Quality control seems lacking
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these paddles and was surprised when one paddle was noticeably heavier than the other paddle. I expected better quality control and some adherence to size and weight standards on a $30 paddle. Otherwise, the paddles and rubber seem to be of reasonable quality and we have been putting them to good use during these COVID-19 days of blight.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Sweet spot between price and performance
customer_reviews.text: I choose this because it's the sweet spot between price and performance. If you want to get a nice paddle to play with, but don't have a money tree growing in the backyard - this is your guy
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lishman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent paddle!
customer_reviews.text: The difference was night & day after playing with this paddle. There are certainly no pros playing here, but the little extra money I spent on a higher quality paddle greatly improved my game. The paddle seems well made and it appears like I'm going to get many, many hours of play without it falling apart. I also purchased another paddle in the same price range that gets the same 5 star review. Game on!
customer_reviews.author: Gilmour

customer_reviews.title: Best paddle ever.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t played in 20 years. This paddle has the perfect balance of control and power and has helped me dial in my old skills. Beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: BestAmazonReviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent paddle for the money. Storage box arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The paddle size feels great in my hands... other paddles have felt slightly too small (I wear a XL gloves for reference purposes). The storage box with a magnetic clasp is a great addition, however, due to poor packaging, mine arrived with the bottom of the storage box ripped open.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helped me run the table....but couldn't take down my arch-nemesis. His time will come.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: A slot, sluggish bat
customer_reviews.text: First off, I bought this paddle specifically for the way the ratings were balanced, with control being rated much higher than speed and spin. That was my mistake. I don't dislike the paddle, but from the first use, it felt sluggish and slow.. I imagine exactly as it's supposed to. Well, I used it for a few hours against my usual opponents, and my personal experience was a slower game with significantly less spin and power. Again, surprise, surprise. I like that the colors are different, which some people seem to hate for some reason, but overall, this is a beginner level paddle focused on a different style of play than mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Brand, bad paddle
customer_reviews.text: This is most definitely a beginner paddle. The brand Killer Spin is very popular and often thrown around by very good players. The only issue is that this one is a beginner paddle that just looks very good but definitely not meant for intensive play.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Fung

customer_reviews.title: Fun for beginner and intermediate
customer_reviews.text: Even though this advertises for beginners I liked the solid feel of the wood. I took off the rubber sold with the paddle and placed different softer one and it made the paddle feel alot better. Still great if you are just starting or know how to play also the book is really nice
customer_reviews.author: Ackeem Rhooms

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, no speed or stroke , just bad
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this paddle is rated at 4.4 stars. Build quality is terrible. My handle started falling apart within first 20 days . The speed /stroke is non existent. It's a terrible paddle in all aspects. I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Whinoceros

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and packaging but assembled poorly
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying the "red" racket, it's not actually red. It has a yellowish color, but if you don't care about the color the Racket itself is of good quality, on the other hand the adhesive that goes all around the blade of the racket feels like bad plastic, and was glued as if the manufacturer was in a hurry or under the influence, there are bumps on almost ever 10 cm of the adhesive plastic, needless to say that part isn't used for anything but it ruins the whole professional look of the racket
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: This paddle sucks
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this paddle if you like good control, spin, or speed. All this POS does is send it. Its heavy as hell, and sends the ball much further than you are intending it to. I use multiple paddles. Thought this would be good, but it just isn't. It is decent as putting spin on the ball, but not enough to warrant buying it. Do yourself a favor and buy a good Stiga with legitimate ratings and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Elliott

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: First time using this new paddle I was amazed at the spin and control. Having only used the paddles that came with the table these are a huge upgrade. I entered a tournament that our city puts on every year and took second place. Decided table tennis might be my future so I asked my job to only work me part time and have been training daily hoping to make the Olympic team. Some say I am crazy but when you enter a tournament of 9 people which only 4 of them were children and you get second place it is an obvious sign that you are a table tennis master. Look for me in Tokyo 2020
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Luke

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to control
customer_reviews.text: Paddle arrived as described, but it is extremely difficult to control. You can create a ton of spin but if you want to hit the ball with any power, good luck. The ball jumps on the paddle very easily, and offers little to no control. I would highly avoid if you are used to having any power in your game. This paddle is more of a finesse style paddle, and definitely not a power paddle. Also, the paddle has a very short grip as others have mentioned. Not worth the money IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: Good grip and good padding.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and highly recommended for beginners. I really like this paddle although it is a little heavy for me. I can use it spin the ball easily and I feel I have a lot of control of it. I can slam the ball with full power and spinning. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ting Dai

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far the glue is holding up. The surface is super tacky and grips wonderfully. You can accidently spin with this paddle. I bought 4 of these for my table and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Brentwood

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this ping pong paddle! My brother bought it and wouldn't put it down he even took it to school and played (they have ping pong tables there) we have a ping pong table at home and every night after dinner he would beg to play and he would always win. It has "top spin" and it's just he right weight! I would recommend this tool to pleasure!
customer_reviews.author: Jackson r

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle. Actually!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to be budget friendly but still decent play. Ended up being as good or better than any other paddle I’ve used. Can’t see any reason to get a more expensive paddle!
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Great starter / amateur paddle
customer_reviews.text: if you're planning to upgrade from those paddles that come from your generic table tennis sets, this is a great one. you will feel a change and improvement in your game right away as you start trying out spins and such.
customer_reviews.author: KManga

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for beginners. You can really feel the spin you can put on the ball with this paddle. If anything the handle could be a little longer to accommodate bigger hands. At the end of the day, I like it a lot (Lloyd Christmas voice).
customer_reviews.author: Daynon Hohm

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle for the price
customer_reviews.text: We play a ping pong table at my office and a few of my co-workers bought paddles that were $40-$50. This paddle feels very comparable to those. I am a casual player, but this paddle is great for maintaining spin and staying competitive compared to the cheap thin paddles that came with our ping pong table.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Light paddle with solid construction
customer_reviews.text: The paddle is very light and it feels solid. The handle and neck of the paddle were not sanded smooth. I used some sandpaper to round the wood along the neck and smooth the handle so it’s more comfortable in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: superdataman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Paddle Overall but bit heavy on handle
customer_reviews.text: Have a ping pong table for breaks at work and this paddle is passed around a lot!!! Overall a great buy but the handle is heavy. I am use to it though and really love it but there were several players who prefer a very light handle but the padding and everything else is excellent weight at the handle is according to preference
customer_reviews.author: Vera Coggins

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. My friend got one and I could play much better with it than the one I bought for $15 on here. Not even sure what brand it was. Some Asian name. I bought my own and it’s been amazing. Great feel. Great spring and control. I’ve really been able to step up my game because of its consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Mario-Corinne G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is great for the price and provides exceptional spin. We have a ping pong table at work and this gives me the edge I needed over my coworkers. Now we never get anything done.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: To start with the killer spin. It says lightweight. Which I have to say it is. It’s slightly heavier then a regular Walmart one. The unboxing was nice. It comes with a marker. I assume it’s to sign the solo cups at parties, after you demolish your friends or noobs! You can also use the marker to get the ladies numbers. All in all. Great paddle for the money. So in the words of feng less talkie talkie more ping pong.
customer_reviews.author: Son

customer_reviews.title: It's a very nice paddle which offers great control
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice paddle which offers great control. My only reservation is that it doesn't come with a zip-up case. Instead, it comes with a box, which I'm not a fan of, but the paddle itself more than makes up for that shortcoming.
customer_reviews.author: Kaslai

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Better than the cheaper paddles that come with a table, but not the highest quality paddle I've ever used. It does the trick though, and I didn't have to drop more than $20.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Love it as a total beginner
customer_reviews.text: Love it as a total beginner! The racket is slow, so I can understand how I'm hitting the ball and why it moves the way it does. It's also decent traction, so I can understand what's happening with spin.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great for novice players
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the purchase for your novice player. You have much more control than with your cheap paddle. Great for learning how to add spin.
customer_reviews.author: Chad D

customer_reviews.title: Nice paddle
customer_reviews.text: I have played a few games with this paddle and I really like it. Everyone that I have played against dose not like it because of the spin that I can put on the ball
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken - I still suck! (just kidding, it wasn't broken)
customer_reviews.text: A nice paddle, happy with the weight. Seems more durable than the bulk paddles we had at work which have mostly fallen apart after a few months. In any case, even for a casual player its nice to have a your own paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Frappier

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why it is Best Seller at Amazon. It’s a low quality paddle with no ability to spin the ball. I will not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Akshata

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight
customer_reviews.text: The quality looks good but it is rather light weight for me. The handle seems a bit small/short. I need a little heavier.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchase a ping pong table for my office & also purchase this paddle so I could kick everyone in my office @$$ is works great and quality is superior to those costing double or triple the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Ingraffia

customer_reviews.title: Love this paddle.
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time. It stayed sticky for a very long time, but after a few months, that has gone down a bit. It hasn't cracked at all, and the wood is completely intact. Pretty high quality, especially for a rookie like me.
customer_reviews.author: Tate Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Really Great!!
customer_reviews.text: The Bat was a bit bigger than I was expecting, but I started using it right away when I got it, it feels nice in my hands and looks amazing, had a little trouble with the sticker with company name it was a little loose, but the bat is well made and def made for beginners who want to try and get better for whatever reason that it may be. Also as it said the Bat has a lot of ball control and it really does.
customer_reviews.author: Vamp

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle- wish it had a case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle for the price. I wish it would come with a carrying case though Instead of a bulky cardboard box.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Great racquets
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner racquets for the money. Love the blue vanilla color. Should last a while and no funky chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: We have a new ping pong table and needed paddles. I purchased these based on price, reviews and Amazon's endorsement. At first glance, I'm impressed with the build quality. These look like they'll last a long time. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Blue is not as good as the brown pads.
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, the blue ones do not work as well as our brown padded one. I thought all the pad colors performed the same. But apparently not. I would give out brown padded one 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: C KENNEDY

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for beginner
customer_reviews.text: The price on this item was awesome. The grip is really good as long as you keep it clean and take care of it. I have had 2 now and they hold up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Control!
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is easy to master, It took me around 2-3 hours to maintain my shots and beat my rivals. I am playing for a year and a half now while playing with 3-star paddles. The Jet200 feels way better than any other bat at it's level and it is surely worth the money. Perfectly suited for intermediate players. PS. You should buy a rubber cleaner for maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Yarin

customer_reviews.title: Good control, no extra bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.text: Good basic racket/paddle. Has good control and works well for me. It is not fancy and offers not a lot of extra spin, but control is what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Usama

customer_reviews.title: Very nice paddle
customer_reviews.text: Had not played table tennis in 15 years so it takes a bit of time to get the feel of the spin back. But, the paddle is very solid and the grip comfortable. The ball jumps off the paddle face and you can really hit the top spin great. This would not necessarily be for a brand new beginner but someone who has played a bit...yes, can be a great tournament racket
customer_reviews.author: pence777

customer_reviews.title: Made me look like a pro..
customer_reviews.text: Great! I’m no ping pong star but some of the boys and I got a little competitive at work and I wanted to look cooler than they did. Turns out it’s the perfect step up If your trying to get a little more serious. It made me look like a pro until everyone bought the same one.... then I sucked again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Handle splitting - brand new.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new just received and found handle is splitting apart. Didn't expect from this Brand. Packaging/ boxing is good but the actual stuff is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: makeer

customer_reviews.title: its so so
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bat to ensure i could spin at times, i have been playing for quite a while but this bat doesnt spin the ball much, its center is the only core where the bat does give a smooth knock sound, everywhere else, it sounds like hitting a ply. would recommend for basic usage, would probably return as didnt meet the3 expectation.
customer_reviews.author: aashish mahajan

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Okay starting paddle, good paddle for the money though if you stick with the sport you will be upgrading quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Actually a 4. 5. A tad heavy and ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually a 4.5. A tad heavy and leaves marks on my middle finger if I play more than three games...does make noticeable impact on shots. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Doug L.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Only after few uses seems very durable. Sticker on the side is already peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: gaby

customer_reviews.title: Friends at my school seem to like it a lot and it does put great spin ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first paddle I have ever bought. It seems to work very well and made solid. It is a little on the heavy side but I feel I'm a defensive player so don't need the light paddle. Friends at my school seem to like it a lot and it does put great spin on the ball. Overall would recommend paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Paddle On!
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle.for less than $20.00 USD. In the right hands one can serve a killer spin! Paddle on!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: this paddle is legit
customer_reviews.text: This thing creates some major speed while still controlling spin. Really good value IMO.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Met my intermediate skills needs
customer_reviews.text: Getting back into ping pong now the kids have started. Really just looking for a good, reasonably priced paddle for a knock around. This has met those needs nicely. Blue on one side and black on the other. Also bought some Stiga ones that were different colors for the kids. Those were more expensive. I can get some good spin on this but it is really just used as a fun paddle, nothing serious. Only 4 stars as it is not high end but still quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Totally loco!

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful spin and beautiful power mix
customer_reviews.text: I played tennis in highschool and switched to ping pong freshman year of college. I love this paddle and it's a guaranteed good hit.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the spin created and its comfortable in hand. Has help up solidly for me so far. Only thing that brings it down to 4 stars is the weight, if it would just be an ounce or two lighter it would be perfect. Its probably the heaviest paddle I've played with, but I'm fairly a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mares

customer_reviews.title: Up your game for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Want to up your game but don't want to spend much $$? Then get this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Friend love it
customer_reviews.text: This paddle was a gift for a friend that plays pong with us. He loves it and loves the spins and performance. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andres DeJesus

customer_reviews.title: waste of time
customer_reviews.text: This product does nothing for an edge on talent. Not happy and its' heavy.
customer_reviews.author: David Wolan

customer_reviews.title: A good paddle.
customer_reviews.text: For me, a low-level player, this is an excellent paddle. Not sure how an advanced player would rate it.
customer_reviews.author: J-ray

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for ping pong. Makes shots and spin on ball easier
customer_reviews.author: Liz Cosline

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Company
customer_reviews.text: I love the paddle, lightweight, well made. More importantly I am so impressed with the company. This is a family owned business, and I received a very nice handwritten thank you for purchasing, in addition to a contact if I have any questions concerns or issues. You do not see companies like this anymore. Love it! Larry Hill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent paddle for the price, purchased a second one since we liked it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Pasadena MD

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a non-pro
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this paddle worked very well for me. Good value for a non-pro. A student had a higher-cost model in a different brand and I did notice it was lighter than this one. But for my purposes, that was not big deal.
customer_reviews.author: ByngSooner

customer_reviews.title: My game is far better than with the standard super hard Stiga ones you ...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoying ponging from time to time. My game is far better than with the standard super hard Stiga ones you can get a 4pack for $15.
customer_reviews.author: John Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bat! “Paddle” I’m just a recreational player but I will never use a super cheap paddle again. It is night and day. I ordered my second after like 5 minutes of playing with this because it’s just unfair to take on someone with a garbage paddle lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSED! If you are not a PRO, this is the way to GO!
customer_reviews.text: I alternate between a Stiga Pro Carbon and this one... I don't feel any difference... Enough said! The packaging is amazing as it doubles as a hard shell carrying case. Great addition to my table tennis toolbox!
customer_reviews.author: C Mastory

customer_reviews.title: Just an average Paddle but cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and average paddle for beginners. For beginners because its cheap but not so much because it does not have much to offer besides price that can make user learn and grasp the skills of top spin or back spin. I can say if you are more of a block player it kind be of help.
customer_reviews.author: sumit s.

customer_reviews.title: Super light, great spin and control
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is super light and puts a great spin on the ball. I enjoyed it so much, and some of the other players noticed the control I had so I would up ordering two more paddles!
customer_reviews.author: Calista Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good quality ping pong bat for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ping pong bat is good for the price. One side is black and the other blue.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Best value for your money
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better paddle for this price. I get compliments on it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Good paddle for beginning or intermediate play. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bastin

customer_reviews.title: If you want to beat everyone in the neighborhood get this paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, I seamlessly beat everyone in the neigborhood with this paddle on a pretty regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent paddle for the price
customer_reviews.text: We play some fairly serious ping pong every day at work, and this was my first upgrade from a cheap paddle. Control and spin are appropriate and it doesn't play to fast. Rubber is quite tacky. Might be a little heavier than some are used to, but it didn't take me long to adjust to this.
customer_reviews.author: H. Dahnke

customer_reviews.title: Slow and spinny
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than other paddles, but the stickiness of the striking surface is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Carsten C. Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Meeehh heavy and jumpy.
customer_reviews.text: heavy and ball is bouncing all over place, this higher priced model from the same company is solid, prob the best racket I've ever played with.
customer_reviews.author: akius

customer_reviews.title: Best for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I would consider myself as an intermediate and I have improved a lot with this paddle. Nice spin and speed.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, just as pictured. But with tax, it costs the same as it does on killerspin website which doesn’t charge tax. Comes in a nice box, very vibrant color!
customer_reviews.author: Eden McFadden

customer_reviews.title: VERY heavy!
customer_reviews.text: The racket itself seems well-constructed, but it's SUPER heavy!! All my co-workers' rackets are much lighter. Out of about 15ish people that play, this one is the heaviest (and MUCH heavier!). I'm for sure returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Abreu

customer_reviews.title: good paddle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend's bday. We play ping pong weekly. He is above a beginner in terms of level of play and he loves this paddle. It improved his play from the first use. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

product_meta.title: Killerspin JET200 Table Tennis Paddle
product_meta.description: NEW DESIGN with a gift box! The Killerspin JET200 table tennis paddle is one of the best sellers on the market…for good reason. With 5 layers of premium wood and performance rubbers, the JET200 is a step up from comparable rackets in terms of power, control and spin. The equal-weight distribution and quality construction is engineered to cater to the all-around player’s game with a focus on precision shots and finesse. Superior feel with power to spare allows you to utilize all aspects of your game for precise placement and hard-hitting shots when needed. The green/black rubber combination will add style and flair to your game as you hone your skills with the JET200. The product comes with a 30-day limited warranty.
feature_bullets: SHARPEN YOUR SKILLS: The perfect table tennis paddle for learning basic strokes and perfecting ball control, this racket is designed for recreational ping pong players who want to improve their game
SUPERIOR CONSTRUCTION: Blade consists of 5 layer wood and Jet Basic rubbers to perfect your skills, while flexible PVC tape surrounds the ping pong racket for protection
PERSONALIZED MEMORY BOOK: Store your ping pong paddle in a gift-worthy storage case and record scores, collect signatures, and write personalized messages
DIMENSIONS: Flared handle table tennis paddle measures 6” x 6 1/8”
